member.name: T:Argix.Data.Mediator
member.summary: Abstract base class with a Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper interface for creating concrete mediators to data stores (i.e. database, web service, file system, etc).

member.name: F:Argix.Data.Mediator.COMMAND_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT
member.summary: Default SQL command timeout = 30sec.

member.name: F:Argix.Data.Mediator.COMMAND_TIMEOUT_INFINITE
member.summary: Infinite SQL command timeout = 0sec.

member.name: F:Argix.Data.Mediator.WEBCLIENTPROXY_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT
member.summary: Default web client proxy timeout = 30000msec.

member.name: F:Argix.Data.Mediator.WEBCLIENTPROXY_TIMEOUT_INFINITE
member.summary: Infinite web client proxy timeout = 0msec.

member.name: F:Argix.Data.Mediator.PING_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT
member.summary: Default Ping timeout = 100msec.

member.name: F:Argix.Data.Mediator.SqlCommandTimeout
member.summary: SQL command timeout for every Argix.Data.Mediator instance.

member.name: F:Argix.Data.Mediator.WebClientProxyTimeout
member.summary: Web client proxy timeout for every Argix.Data.Mediator instance.

member.name: F:Argix.Data.Mediator.PingTimeout
member.summary: Ping timeout for every Argix.Data.Mediator instance.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.ReadConfig(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: Stored procedure to call.
Return dataset table name.
Application name filter of configuration entries.
User name filter of configuration entries.
member.returns: A System.Data.DataSet containing the returned configuration data.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.ExecuteDataset(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure.
member.returns: A System.Data.DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.remarks: This method provides no access to output parameters or the stored procedure's return value parameter. Ensure the stored procedure does not use SET NO COUNT. e.g.: bool res = ExecuteNonQuery("PublishOrders", new object[]{24, 36});
member.param: The name of the stored prcedure.
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure.
member.returns: True if the number of rows affected by the command > 0.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.ExecuteNonQueryWithReturn(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a primitive type) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: The name of the stored prcedure.
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure.
member.returns: An object containing the return value.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.ExecuteReader(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: The name of the stored procedure.
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure.
member.returns: A System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.ExecuteScalar(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a 1x1 resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: The name of the stored prcedure.
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure.
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.ExecuteXmlReader(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified SqlConnection using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: The name of the stored prcedure.
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure.
member.returns: An System.Xml.XmlReader containing the resultset generated by the command.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.FillDataset(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: The name of the stored prcedure.
Return dataset table name.
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure.
member.returns: A System.Data.DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command.

member.name: M:Argix.Data.Mediator.UpdateDataset(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Executes the respective command for each inserted, updated, or deleted row in the DataSet.
member.remarks: e.g.: UpdateDataset(insertCommand, deleteCommand, updateCommand, dataSet, "OrderTable");
member.param: The name of the stored procedure to insert new records into the data source.
The name of the stored procedure to delete records from the data source.
The name of the stored procedure used to update records in the data source.
The DataSet used to update the data source
The DataTable used to update the data source.
member.returns: True if the update completed successfully.

member.name: E:Argix.Data.Mediator.DataStatusUpdate
member.summary: Occurs whenever a mediator operation completes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper
member.summary: The SqlHelper class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common uses of SqlClient

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of SqlParameters to a SqlCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of SqlParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: This method assigns dataRow column values to an array of SqlParameters
member.param: Array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Object[])
member.summary: This method assigns an array of values to an array of SqlParameters
member.param: Array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
Array of objects holding the values to be assigned

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.PrepareCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This method opens (if necessary) and assigns a connection, transaction, command type and parameters to the provided command
member.param: The SqlCommand to be prepared
A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
A valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
true if the connection was opened by the method, otherwose is false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.PrepareCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This method opens (if necessary) and assigns a connection, transaction, command type and parameters to the provided command - Dec. 20, 2005 - Added overloaded method with commandTimeout parameter
member.param: The SqlCommand to be prepared
A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
A valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The command timeout value in seconds - default is 30 secs
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
true if the connection was opened by the method, otherwose is false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

The name of the stored prcedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership)
member.summary: Create and prepare a SqlCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
A valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
Indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper
member.returns: SqlDataReader containing the results of the command

member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: A SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified SqlTransaction using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(trans, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid SqlTransaction
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: A SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified SqlTransaction using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid SqlTransaction
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: A SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteScalar(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a 1x1 resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: int orderCount = (int)ExecuteScalar(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrderCount");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteScalar(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a 1x1 resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int orderCount = (int)ExecuteScalar(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrderCount", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteScalar(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a 1x1 resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.FillDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"});
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.FillDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[],System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"}, new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.summary: Private helper method that execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified SqlTransaction and SqlConnection using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(conn, trans, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"}, new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid SqlConnection
A valid SqlTransaction
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.FillDataset(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Int32,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[],System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Addition to the origional Source - Dated Oct. 26, 2004 This allows setting of commandTimeout property on the command object.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection
A valid SqlTransaction
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
Timeout value for the command - different from the connection timeout

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.UpdateDataset(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Executes the respective command for each inserted, updated, or deleted row in the DataSet.
member.remarks: e.g.: UpdateDataset(conn, insertCommand, deleteCommand, updateCommand, dataSet, "Order");
member.param: A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to insert new records into the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to delete records from the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure used to update records in the data source
The DataSet used to update the data source
The DataTable used to update the data source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.CreateCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Simplify the creation of a Sql command object by allowing a stored procedure and optional parameters to be provided
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlCommand command = CreateCommand(conn, "AddCustomer", "CustomerID", "CustomerName");
member.param: A valid SqlConnection object
The name of the stored procedure
An array of string to be assigned as the source columns of the stored procedure parameters
member.returns: A valid SqlCommand object

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQueryTypedParams(System.String,System.String,System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the dataRow column values as the stored procedure's parameters values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on row values.
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQueryTypedParams(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String,System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the specified SqlConnection using the dataRow column values as the stored procedure's parameters values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on row values.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection object
The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQueryTypedParams(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.String,System.Data.DataRow)

member.param: A valid SqlTransaction object
The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteScalarTypedParams(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String,System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a 1x1 resultset) against the specified SqlConnection using the dataRow column values as the stored procedure's parameters values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection object
The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid SqlTransaction object
The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Set command timeout int value globally for all the calls you make to SqlHelper. If not set, it uses default value of 30 secs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership
member.summary: This enum is used to indicate whether the connection was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper, so that we can set the appropriate CommandBehavior when calling ExecuteReader()

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership.Internal
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by SqlHelper

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership.External
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by the caller

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache
member.summary: SqlHelperParameterCache provides functions to leverage a static cache of procedure parameters, and the ability to discover parameters for stored procedures at run-time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache.DiscoverSpParameterSet(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resolve at run time the appropriate set of SqlParameters for a stored procedure
member.param: A valid SqlConnection object
The name of the stored procedure
Whether or not to include their return value parameter
member.returns: The parameter array discovered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache.CloneParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Deep copy of cached SqlParameter array

member.summary: Add parameter array to the cache

The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters to be cached

The stored procedure name or T-SQL command

member.summary: Retrieves the set of SqlParameters appropriate for the stored procedure
member.remarks: This method will query the database for this information, and then store it in a cache for future requests.

The name of the stored procedure
member.returns: An array of SqlParameters
